result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie M Schmidlkofer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 64 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Case 14CF257

superMiscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended  No use or possession of  illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: and certificate filed.

Defendant Stephanie M Schmidlkofer in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 

Sentence of:

4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 64 days )  Concurrent to 14CF257

2 Years of Initial Confinement

2 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

Seek employment;

COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Sentencing hearing on October 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.
